page.title: 12Queen Margaret's School.
page.content: Queen Margaret's School was opened in 1901-originally in Scarborough.It is governed by the Northern Chapter of the Woodard Corporation and is run on a Christian foundation.The school buildings were damaged by enemy action in the war,so during the 1940's the school was evacuated to Castle Howard. The present school transferred to Escrick Park in 1949.There are 250 girls,with a house for younger girls,4 houses for those aged 12-16 years and a 6th form house where each girl has her own study/bedroom facilities.There is a sanatorium with a resident nurse. The school educates girls to university level and offers many varied courses.Recent additions to the many facilities include a new swimming pool,music and riding schools,6th form house and an Art and Design studio.The junior dept.carried out this project.
